channel.title: LED Throwies (Electronic Grafitti)
channel.description:
An LED throwie is a small, battery-powered light, attached to a magnet (usually with conductive epoxy or electrical tape), used for the purpose of creating graffiti and light displays. They were devised by the Graffiti Research Lab as a new kind of graffiti art to be used on ferromagnetic surfaces. Part of GRL's original campaign involved distributing throwies to a group of people, who were then encouraged to throw them onto a metal sculpture, called Alamo, located at Astor Place on the isle of Manhattan in New York City. The low cost of materials and the ease with which throwies can be constructed have led to concern over their potential environmental impact. Namely, that the spent Throwies would not later be collected and eventually the lithium batteries would leak. While the devices are single use, they can be collected later so that the LEDs and magnets can be reused and the batteries can be disposed of properly. Also, IEC LR series batteries can be used instead which pose no environmental risks (other than litter).
(http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Led_Throwies) (Tutorials are under external links) I used the tutorial from I-hacked and made around 10 of them I'm going out tonight to raid the park. Of course im building more in about an hour after I run to the store :)

item.title: LED Throwies (Electronic Grafitti)
item.dc:creator: @hdkilla HDKilla
item.description:
@hdkilla wrote:

therealjdb:

well then…its not graffiti so i guess its just something to do when u have absoulutey nothing else to do. well if anyone wants to try it its here. they really arent the amusing i threw a couple around and i got bored so i threw em into the river…

That was a lot smarter than throwing them into a garbage can.

item.title: LED Throwies (Electronic Grafitti)
item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

What I don’t understand is this: where’s the art form? You’re just attaching LEDs to a battery and (is there a magnet? I didn’t read the whole thing) sticking it to something else. To me, grafitti is where you actually take time and creativity to make something look good.

These are just blinky?

Read full topic
